attributes.action: Give recognition to surviving WW2 veterans in the Queens Honours List.
attributes.additional_details:
The French government have given all surviving veterans that took part in the liberation of France between 1944-45 the Légion d’honneur for their actions.
https://uk.ambafrance.org/Legion-d-honneur-for-British-World-War-II-veterans
We should also recognise their actions and the part they played.
attributes.background: All surviving veterans of WW2 should recognised in Queens Honours List. This would be for all surviving veterans from every allied country no matter what campaign they took part in. Actors, musicians and footballers often get an award, so should our WW2 heroes.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because it asks for someone to be nominated for an honour. 

Members of the public can nominate people for honours directly. You can find out how to nominate someone for an honour here:

https://www.gov.uk/honours
